meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by a policy of territorial or economic expansion.
meanings.sent1: The expansionistic plans of the company led to its rapid growth.
meanings.sent2: The expansionistic nature of the empire resulted in the acquisition of new territories.
meanings.sent3: The expansionistic mindset of the team made them eager to explore new markets.
meanings.sent4: Her expansionistic ambitions knew no bounds as she aimed to conquer new horizons.
meanings.sent5: The expansionistic vision of the leader propelled the organization towards success.

meanings.definition: The belief in or advocacy of territorial or economic expansion.
meanings.sent1: His expansionistic ideals shaped his foreign policy decisions.
meanings.sent2: The expansionistic of the country was evident in its overseas investments.
meanings.sent3: The expansionistic in the room was palpable as they discussed global trade.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, an expansionistic can lead to both risks and rewards.
meanings.sent5: The expansionistic of the explorer inspired others to seek new opportunities.
